summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a BOP Captain (formerly a Lieutenant at MCC New York) conducted on October 27, 2021. The interview focuses on allegations that Correctional Officer Tova Noel was instructed to falsify training documents (SHU quarterly training and suicide prevention training) by signing for training she did not receive. The witness denies the allegations, stating she only informed Noel of the training requirement and that the SHU lieutenant was responsible for the training and sign-in sheets.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a sworn interview with a BOP Captain regarding allegations of falsified training records and procedures at MCC New York related to the Epstein death investigation.

locations: OIG New York Field Office (interview location)
Indiana (witness's home state, where she was during Epstein's death)
keyFacts: Correctional Officer Tova Noel alleged under oath that Lieutenant instructed her to sign SHU quarterly and suicide prevention training documents in June 2019 without actually providing the training, citing the need to pass a program review.

The witness, Captain , vehemently denies instructing Noel to sign the documents falsely, stating she only informed Noel of the training requirement and that the SHU lieutenant was responsible for the training and sign-in process.
The witness maintained a binder of training sign-in sheets in her office, which was accessible to other lieutenants, suggesting Lieutenant could have retrieved the sheets and had Noel sign them.
The interview reveals a direct contradiction under oath between two BOP employees (Noel and the witness) regarding who instructed the falsification of training records.
The witness was not present at MCC on August 9-10, 2019, when Jeffrey Epstein died; she was in Indiana due to her father's stroke and learned of the death from television news.
